comment: Such a great professor! She really cares about actually teaching and helping you with the material, and is so crazy accessible outside of class. She has so many resources available throughout the course, and I would not have passed if she wasn't as supportive and helpful as she is.

the class itself is not difficult its chemistry that is hard. She structures tests in a way she says "prepares you for the ACS final" and a result of that is the tests being hard, but she gives so much extra credit to the point where if you got a 60 if you do the extra credit, it could raise that to am 80. When the final came around it was so easy.
Very nice teacher cares about her students, you have to really not care to fail this class she offers so much help and is very easy to reach. Shes younger so she understands her students.
Great class easy if you pay attention

She is a great professor but the only thing, for me at least, is I didn't like the way she lectured. But if you go to her office hours she will help so much. She also gives a lot of extra credit so I would highly recommend you do them if you take her. Overall sweet lady, just ask questions and you'll be golden.

Take Cordeiro if you want a good teacher and if you want to pass chemistry. Super kind teacher who puts students first and responds to emails super fast. Make sure to actually study and put effort in because the tests are harder than her practice exams. Even if you fail- she gives plenty of extra credit and make up opportunities.

She is a wonderful professor, she really cares about her students and their success. She gives extra credit for all of her exams and they help you out a lot. Attendance is mandatory but she gives the option of joining a teams meeting rather than going in person for her normal lectures. She responds to emails quickly and efficiently.
If you are already bad at chemistry do NOT take her. She makes her exams harder than the actual ACS exam. Take someone else

She's a really kind professor and gives great lectures. She provides plenty of resources for practice, but her tests are much harder than the practice exams or problems. However, she does offer the opportunity to do test corrections to earn points back.

Cordeiro was great and helped me a lot during office hours. The only complaint I have is I would spend like 4 hours in her office hours on TEAMS and do a lot of practice but still do not great on the tests. Her lectures were good but did not correlate very well to the tests she made. I recommend understanding basic principles of chem before taking.

She is very nice and offers a lot of help, but her lectures will not prepare you for the test. They're very slow and crammed last minute. The class is an easy B because of test corrections (half points back) but getting an A in the class is very difficult. The tests she makes are diabolical compared to the practice tests and in class examples.

She is a fantastic teacher and will literally give you like a million ways in trying to understand the content but she is a HARSH test maker. I know chem is a hard class, but the tests are AP styled in their difficulty. It's multiple choice but you only get test corrections to improve your grade. She will keep you on your feet
She was a super slow lecturer and would often cram stuff in the last minute. Made it very hard to get a high grade in the class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She's so sweet and understanding and she puts in so so so so so so much effort to make sure you do well and pass. Tbh the only way to fail is if you don't turn shit in and don't put in any effort. I got a C because chem is hard but she honestly made it understandable and digestable. Pls pls pls take her she's so sweet

You may not like her at first, but Cordeiro wants all students to succeed! She has hard exams but provides test corrections and lots of study material. Chem 1212 is naturally hard, but she will save you if you put in the work! She is extremely accessible outside of class and also records all lectures in D2L.

She was a good teacher but you could kind of tell she used to teach high school. She would move through the lectures very slowly and then she would cram everything we were about to miss a couple of days before the test. Other than that she was very accessible outside of the classroom and she really did her best to make sure everyone understood.

Shes a nice lady but she focuses heavily on simpler topics, while flying over the more complex topics. She does provide you with a lot of resources though to go back and learn anything she didn't completely cover in class, like review PowerPoints, practice homework, practice tests and office hours. Also join a study group, that helps a lot.

Professor Rebekah is kind and caring, but she's not that great at teaching. I relied on my high school chemistry knowledge to pass the class with an A. Attendance doesn't really matter so you can learn everything on your own if Rebekah's teaching style doesn't align with your learning style.

Do not listen to the negative reviews. Cordeiro is the best professor I have had in college so far. Chemistry is a hard class, it's not an easy A no matter who your professor is. Lectures are detailed, you can tell she wants her students to succeed. She posts tons of extra practice links, curved exams, and gave a lot of extra credit opportunities.

I didn't like her at first but once you get to know her you realize she's trying really hard to make a hard class easy. you just have to take the help she offers. she is really accessible outside of class and she helped me with lab even though she wasn't even teaching lab.

I felt like coming into this class I had a strong CHEM foundation from high school that helped alot. She's a super caring professor grades I feel pretty lightly isn't harsh on grading. Offers lots of way for help/contacting her (responds quick). Our tests were curved with opportunity to replace test grade with final exam sections if higher. ALEK HW

DONT TAKE HER!!!!!! The material she goes over in class doesn't align with what's on the exams. Our class average for exam 2 was a 57 & a 48 for exam 1 (w/ 20 point curve). She claimed she told us what would be on the free response on the exam, but no one got it right. Moral of the story don't take her.

I loved her! She always explained things in a way I could understand and always helped me in her office hours. Her class was hard at times, but chemistry is hard in general. I wish I could take her for 1152.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely teach yourself the basic textbook concepts before lectures because she lectures as if you already understand the basic concept behind what she is teaching, and if you dont youre just going to be completely lost. Sometimes flies through problems without fully explaining them as well. Extra credit test corrections are nice though
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: she talks too much about nothing and she is so bad at explaining the stuff she actually does teach, she pulls numbers out with no context. just another class u have to teach yourself in. the ppl that like her had her as a lab professor, im in her lecture

She's great with questions and has a number set up that can be texted anonymously for questions. She explains briefly the concepts and info for each lab. When my lab partner dropped she let me work in a group of 3 instead of alone as well. She is willing to work with you and wants you to do well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is new to KSU and it shows, but I am confident if you are reading this past Fall 2024, take her. My only complaint is that she used to be a highschool teacher clearly used to having class periods longer than 50 minutes, so lectures were sometimes slightly dry. But she cares deeply, and makes herself VERY available to students

Professor cordeiro is so caring and wants her students to pass. If you have any homework/topic questions, you can reach out to her through a phone number you can text her by. Her exams are difficult, but you have other assignments/homework so it won't affect your grade too much. Still, make sure you listen to the lectures. She even records the lec.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: She is really amazing. And gives you a lot of assistance so that you do not fail. She is available for office hours and she provides worksheets for extra practice.
The class content itself is very difficult but she gives so many practice worksheets, help videos, lectures are good, and she has extra credit opportunities. Highly recommend.
Great opportunities to get extra credit. Shows care and compassion, Take her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I know she is trying her best to teach us what we need to know but the majority of the semester me and everyone in my class felt that we did not know anything. our averages for every test were below failing and while she did offer exam corrections, they did not help much and she complained about having to grade them after she assigned it...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Highly recommend for lab! She would provide her students with her phone number, and we could text her anytime we had a question about the lab report. She explains everything really well in the pre-lab lectures, so you know what's going on.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Cordeiro is extremely helpful and is an amazing Professor. She is quick to respond to emails, and provides many opportunities to get assistance in and outside the lab. She really just wants to see her students succeed. Her grading isn't harsh at all and she grades by how accurate your math is even if your data is inaccurate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I think her intentions are right but can be a bit harsh if you do not know something you are supposed to. After the first 3 exams, she ranted basically on how she is trying to help us even though test averages were in the 55%. I think if you do not plan on lecturing yourself ahead of time, it'll be hard to get some topics when she explains them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: There is only one hard homework every week and one take-home quiz for each chapter. Although chemistry is difficult, I do not think she does a great job explaining topics or oftentimes leaves out information that may be implied. Also, it would be in your best interest to look at lecture notes beforehand because she goes very fast through lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is by far the best professor I have ever had! She is really caring towards her students and our success is the most important thing to her. She is super nice and approachable, and she is always available during office hours. There is weekly homework and she gives the best extra credit opportunities that boosted my grade from a C to A. THE BEST!

she is the best!! i always had SO many questions, but she answered all of them right away. Spent many hours in office hours and she was never annoyed, was so happy to help. TAKE HER! Only had her for Chem 1212L, not chem 1212

(Chem 1212) She is SUPER available. Gives weekly smartworks hw. Has a ton of ways to reach her. My problem was how she would often (moreso at the beginning of sem) not do examples and just expect us to get it without being shown a proper problem of concepts. This isn't like chem 1211, the concepts are very different. I found the class really hard

This woman is the best chemistry teacher I have ever had. She responds to emails and texts so quickly, is so good at explaining hard concepts, and gives us every opportunity to pass (extra credit). She posts recordings of the class and all notes and extra practice. Bless this woman. Take this class please! It's hard but she makes it worth it.
